intro: Hieracium ctenodon, commonly known as the hooked hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium ctenodon thrives in meadows and grasslands, often in sunny, well-drained soils.
